Class Player

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.entities.Entity
model.entities.Player
public class Player extends Entity
player model, handles everything that a player does: movement, object interaction, computer screen navigation. provides multiple getter methods to access the player instance's current state.

  • Field Details

    • levelManager

      private LevelManager levelManager
      reference to LevelManager.

    • currentRoom

      private Room currentRoom
      current room that the player is in. provides various useful methods that allow the player to interact with its current room. see Room.

    • isMoving

      private boolean isMoving
      flag that tracks if the player is moving or not

    • isOnGround

      private boolean isOnGround
      flag that tracks if the player is on a tile or not

    • isJumping

      private boolean isJumping
      flag that tracks if the player is jumping or not

    • interactionCompleted

      private boolean interactionCompleted
      flag that tracks if the player has completed a interactable object search

    • interactionHoldTime

      private int interactionHoldTime
      time that the player has held down the interaction/search button (e).

    • SEARCH_COMPLETE_TIME

      private final int SEARCH_COMPLETE_TIME
      time needed to finish a search. once this time is up, it will trigger the interact() method.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • showingInteractionPrompt

      private boolean showingInteractionPrompt
      flag that checks if the interaction prompt should show up or not

    • currentInteractable

      private InteractableObject currentInteractable
      player's current interactable. if the player is near an interactable object, then this will change into that interactable object.

    • MAX_ALLOWED_OBJECT_DISTANCE

      private final int MAX_ALLOWED_OBJECT_DISTANCE
      max allowed distance from the player and an interactable object. the interaction prompt won't show if the player is outside of this range. this number was chosen because provided to be comfortable, so that the player would not access interactable objects that are too distant.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • verticalSpeed

      private int verticalSpeed
      represents the player's vertical speed.

    • GRAVITY

      private final int GRAVITY
      gravity constant. it is always applied to the player's verticalSpeed when the player is jumping or falling down.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_JUMP_SPEED

      private final int MAX_JUMP_SPEED
      speed of the player jump. when the player presses space, its verticalSpeed will spike to this number, moving the player vertically
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • isClimbing

      private boolean isClimbing
      flag that indicates if the player is climbing or not.

    • currentLadder

      private Ladder currentLadder
      player's closest and climbable ladder.

    • CLIMB_SPEED

      private static final int CLIMB_SPEED
      player's ladder climbing speed.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • inventory

      private final Inventory inventory
      player's Inventory

    • gameOver

      private boolean gameOver
      game over flag. if the player dies, then this flag gets set to true and it respawns at the last checkpoint(lastCheckpointX, lastCheckpointY via resetToCheckpoint(). it does not end the game, it indicates whether the player died or not.

    • lastCheckpointX

      private int lastCheckpointX
      tracks the last checkpoint's triggered x coordinate

    • lastCheckpointY

      private int lastCheckpointY
      tracks the last checkpoint's triggered y coordinate

    • extracted

      private boolean extracted
      extraction flag. if this flag is set to true, then the ResultScreenView (result screen) gets set to visible, and the game ends.

    • scoreTracker

      private final ScoreTracker scoreTracker
      reference to the ScoreTracker instance

    • wasGameOver

      private boolean wasGameOver
      flag that tracks if the player died or not. used to send a single notification, otherwise it would send multiple notifications.

    • wasMoving

      private boolean wasMoving
      flag that tracks if the player was moving or not. used to send a single notification, otherwise it would send multiple notifications.

    • lastFootStepTime

      private long lastFootStepTime
      last footstep time, used to calculate the footstep sound timing in the update(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) method.

    • FOOTSTEP_SOUND_INTERVAL

      private final long FOOTSTEP_SOUND_INTERVAL
      interval between footsteps
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      player constructor: sets some default values, initializes its inventory and scoreTracker fields. sets as observers: ScoreTracker and AudioManager. the score tracker tracks the player's actions, such as opening an interactable object, which gives some points. the audio manager gets notified of when the player is moving, jumping, if the player died. note: PlayerView is not registered as an observer, because during the initial part of the game development the observer pattern was not implemented... and because of that, the player view just gets updated via getters methods.

  • Method Details

    • setDefaultValues

      private void setDefaultValues()
      sets some of the player default values, to not crown the constructor too much. sets its starting x position, y position, width, height, speed, initial direction, isOnGround flag, isJumping flag, gameOver flag.

    • update

      public void update(boolean upPressed, boolean downPressed, boolean leftPressed, boolean rightPressed, boolean spacePressed, boolean ePressed, boolean upArrowPressed, boolean downArrowPressed, boolean enterPressed)
      core of the player logic, processes gravity, horizontal movement, jump movement, ladder movement, object interaction, computer menu navigation, sound logic (notifies the AudioManager. note: it is very long, and it is not being broken down into smaller methods because it has been WAY easier to debug and implement logic when needed. having little methods scattered into the player class had been a nightmare for me navigate around and debug. each section has a inline comment to highlight its function.
      Parameters:
      upPressed - w pressed
      downPressed - s pressed
      leftPressed - a pressed
      rightPressed - d pressed
      spacePressed - space pressed
      ePressed - e, interaction button pressed
      upArrowPressed - up arrow pressed, for computer menu navigation
      downArrowPressed - down arrow pressed, for computer menu navigation
      enterPressed - enter pressed, for confirming the current computer option selected

    • isNearLadder

      private boolean isNearLadder()
      scans through the interactable objects (because Ladder is one) in the current room, and sets the currentLadder to the ladder closest to the player.
      Returns:
      true if the player is near a ladder

    • isWithinDistance

      private boolean isWithinDistance(InteractableObject obj)
      compute if player is near to an object or not using the pythagorean theorem. depends on the MAX_ALLOWED_OBJECT_DISTANCE field.
      Parameters:
      obj - current interactable object
      Returns:
      true if the player is near enough

    • updateCurrentInteractable

      private boolean updateCurrentInteractable()
      check if player is near an interactable object, sets the currentInteractable field if it is near. handles some edge cases: if the player's inventory's full, it will return false, so the showingInteractionPrompt is set to false in the update(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) method. the inventory is not considered 'full' if the player has a ComputerCard. if the computer's menu is visible, then the currentInteractable field is set to be the computer.
      Returns:
      true the interactable object is isWithinDistance(InteractableObject).

    • interact

      private void interact()
      interacts with the currentInteractable, sends an appropriate notification to the respective observers. calls the interactable object's .open() method, the interaction logic is handled in the respective interactable object's open() method.

    • resetToCheckpoint

      private void resetToCheckpoint()
      resets the player to the last checkpoint (TileManager tile number 99)

    • checkPlayerHasCard

      private boolean checkPlayerHasCard()
      checks if the player has a card
      Returns:
      true if the player has a ComputerCard in his inventory

    • checkCollisionWithTile

      protected boolean checkCollisionWithTile(int playerX, int playerY)
      checks if the player is colliding against some tile. each player edge has 4 collision points, so it prevents the player from slipping through tiles. it is divided in 4 other helper methods to check each edge: checkTopEdgeCollision(int, int, int, int, int[][]), checkBottomEdgeCollision(int, int, int, int, int[][]) checkLeftEdgeCollision(int, int, int, int, int[][]) checkRightEdgeCollision(int, int, int, int, int[][]). it overrides the Entity check collision system with some minor tweaks: it checks if the current tile is a death tile or the extraction tile.
      Overrides:
      checkCollisionWithTile in class Entity
      Parameters:
      playerX - player's current x coordinate
      playerY - player's current y coordinate
      Returns:
      true if player is colliding with some tile

    • checkTopEdgeCollision

      protected boolean checkTopEdgeCollision(int collisionPointsForEachEdge, int left, int right, int entityTopRow, int[][] roomData)
      checks the player's top edge collision points. returns true if there's a collision.
      Overrides:
      checkTopEdgeCollision in class Entity
      Parameters:
      collisionPointsForEachEdge - number of collision points for this edge
      left - player's leftmost point
      right - player's rightmost point
      entityTopRow - player's top row in grid coordinates
      roomData - current room's data
      Returns:
      true if there's a collision with a tile

    • checkBottomEdgeCollision

      protected boolean checkBottomEdgeCollision(int collisionPointsForEachEdge, int left, int right, int entityBottomRow, int[][] roomData)
      checks the player's bottom edge collision points. returns true if there's a collision.
      Overrides:
      checkBottomEdgeCollision in class Entity
      Parameters:
      collisionPointsForEachEdge - number of collision points for this edge
      left - player's leftmost point
      right - player's rightmost point
      entityBottomRow - player's bottom row in grid coordinates
      roomData - current room's data
      Returns:
      true if there's a collision with a tile

    • checkLeftEdgeCollision

      protected boolean checkLeftEdgeCollision(int collisionPointsForEachEdge, int bottom, int top, int playerLeftCol, int[][] roomData)

      Overrides:

    • checkRightEdgeCollision

      protected boolean checkRightEdgeCollision(int collisionPointsForEachEdge, int bottom, int top, int playerRightCol, int[][] roomData)

      Overrides:

      public void setLevelManager(LevelManager levelManager)
